title: Iranians use annual fire festival to renew anti-government protests
description: Protesters used the occasion of Chaharshanbe Suri — a celebration with Zoroastrian roots — to take to the streets and chant anti-government slogans.

title: Plan to make mRNA vaccines in developing countries needs U.S. funding, backers say
description: The mRNA "vaccine hubs" program backed by the WHO recently asked the United States for $100 million. It has yet to receive a response.

title: 16 migrants detained after cargo ship jump in Puerto Rico
description: Federal authorities are investigating a group of at least 16 migrants who apparently were stowaways aboard a cargo ship headed to Puerto Rico and jumped into the ocean as it neared the U.S. territory

title: Mexican soldiers find 1.8 million fentanyl pills in Tijuana
description: Mexico’s Defense Department says soldiers found over 1.83 million fentanyl pills at a stash house in the border city of Tijuana

title: Five years after Rio councilwoman slain, questions and hope
description: Supporters gathered Tuesday in Rio de Janeiro to mark five years since the assassination of Black, bisexual councilwoman Marielle Franco amid hope that investigations into her death will accelerate under Brazil’s new leftist president

title: Syrian president Assad arrives in Moscow, set to meet Putin
description: Syrian President Bashar Assad has arrived in Moscow, where he is scheduled to meet top ally Russian President Vladimir Putin

title: Mexico to use traditional medicine, more Cuban doctors
description: Health authorities in Mexico say they will use more traditional medicine and more Cuban doctors in the country’s woefully underequipped public hospital system

title: Polish Church defends John Paul sainthood after abuse claims
description: The leaders of Poland’s Catholic Church have spoken in defense of the late John Paul II’s sainthood and of his fast-track canonization process

title: Fake sex abuse claims get British woman 8.5 year prison term
description: A 22-year-old woman who falsely claimed she was groomed by an Asian gang, drugged, raped and forced to work as a prostitute has been jailed for more than eight years in a case that fueled racial tensions in Britain

title: Russian jets force down U.S. drone over Black Sea, military says
description: The incident prompted U.S. drone pilots to bring down the MQ-9 Reaper in international waters.

title: Photos show devastation as Cyclone Freddy hits southern Africa a second time
description: Cyclone Freddy is among the strongest tropical cyclones ever observed in the Southern Hemisphere.

title: 2 'The Voice of Holland' ex-stars face sex offense charges
description: Prosecutors say that two former stars of “The Voice of Holland” will be charged with sex offenses linked to the once-popular Dutch talent show

title: Could scientist Claudia Sheinbaum be Mexico’s next leader?
description: Mexico is a year away from electing its next head of state and the potential candidate getting the most attention is an environmental scientist who could become the first female leader of Latin America’s second-largest economy

title: Hundreds dead as Cyclone Freddy wrecks Malawi, Mozambique
description: The devastating Tropical Cyclone Freddy which has ripped through southern Africa in a rare second landfall has killed at least 216 people in Malawi and Mozambique since Saturday night, with the death toll expected to continue to rise

title: Dutch court convicts man of removing condom without consent
description: A Dutch man has been convicted of removing his condom during sex without his partner’s consent, in the first trial in the Netherlands for so-called “stealthing.”

title: Romanian court rejects bail request by divisive Andrew Tate
description: An official says a Romanian court has rejected a bail request from the divisive social media influencer and former professional kickboxer Andrew Tate, who is detained in the country on suspicion of organized crime and human trafficking

title: Andrey Kurkov, Maryse Condé on International Booker list
description: Ukrainian novelist Andrey Kurkov and acclaimed Guadeloupe-born writer Maryse Condé are among 13 contenders for the International Booker Prize for translated fiction

title: Polish court convicts activist of providing abortion pills in landmark case
description: The case has been closely watched in the United States, where lawsuits against people who helped with medicated abortions are beginning to emerge in states that have tightened abortion restrictions since Roe v. Wade was overturned.

title: EU assesses new electricity plan in wake of energy crisis
description: The European Union is working on a thorough reform of its electricity market to shield citizens from sudden price spikes, speed up the use of renewable energy sources and make the bloc more independent in an increasingly unstable world

title: Canadian driver faces murder charges in ramming, 2 killed
description: A 38-year-old Canadian man is facing murder charges after a pickup truck rammed into pedestrians, killing two men and injuring nine other people walking beside a road

title: German police: 2 children in custody over girl's killing
description: German police say two children are in custody suspected of killing a 12-year-old girl found dead earlier this week in the western town of Freudenberg

title: Witnesses say extremist attack in Somalia kills at least 9
description: Witnesses say at least nine people, including five soldiers, were killed Tuesday when an explosives-laden car targeted the entrance of a guest house in the southern Somalia town of Bardhere in Gedo region

title: Is Hugh Grant rude or just British? Oscars interview may be lost in translation.
description: The actor's awkward interview with model Ashley Graham at the Academy Awards sparked debate on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Netherlands repatriates indigenous remains to St. Eustatius
description: The Netherlands has returned the remains of nine indigenous people that archaeologists found more than 30 years ago in the tiny Dutch Caribbean island of St. Eustatius

title: 1 victim's life still in danger after Hamburg shooting
description: Authorities say one victim’s life is still in danger after last week’s shooting at a Jehovah’s Witness hall in Hamburg in which a former member of the congregation killed six people and then himself

title: Greek archaeologists protest holiday island assault
description: State-employed archaeologists in Greece have launched strike action to protest an assault on an archaeologist on the island of Mykonos, an attack they say may have been linked to commercial pressure to extend tourism development

title: Indian government opposes same-sex marriage, warns of countrywide ‘havoc’
description: In the clearest indication of the government's stance on same-sex marriage, it argued in the Supreme Court that marriage should be defined by parliament.

title: Global regulators grapple with fallout of Silicon Valley Bank collapse
description: Regulators from Canada to Germany are making moves to assess and minimize harm after the closure of SVB, which had overseas branches in eight countries.

title: After 70 years of writing, Elena Poniatowska has more questions
description: The influential Mexican writer has chronicled every major social movement in the country for decades. Still writing at 90, she's sought out by a new generation.

title: Chinese SARS whistleblower Jiang Yanyong dies at 91
description: Reports say Jiang Yanyong, a Chinese military doctor who revealed the full extent of the 2003 SARS outbreak and was later placed under house arrest for his political outspokenness, has died

title: Ukraine live briefing: Bakhmut ‘very tough,’ Kyiv says; GOP contenders differ on Ukraine support
description: Russian forces haven't been able to encircle the city, analysts said. Republicans Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis said Ukraine was not a vital interest.

title: Lula meets with Indigenous in Brazil's Amazon, pledges lands
description: On his first trip to Indigenous land in the Amazon rainforest since taking office, Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has expressed support for the creation of new territories for those communities

title: A record-breaking storm wreaks havoc in southern Africa
description: Cyclone Freddy has battered Mozambique and become the Earth’s longest-lived tropical storm.
